data.title: Canyon Partners, LLC
data.meta_description: Canyon has more than 200 professionals worldwide, including approximately 70 investment professionals and 90 operational professionals.
data.text:
Los Angeles

Doug Anderson is a Partner and Canyon’s Chief Compliance Officer. Mr. Anderson joined Canyon in 2005 and is responsible for monitoring compliance with the federal and state securities laws as well as client mandates. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Anderson was a senior Securities Compliance Examiner with the Pacific Regional Office of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for over five years. Mr. Anderson was responsible for conducting compliance examinations (routine and cause) of various investment advisers and investment companies. Mr. Anderson is a graduate of the University of California, Davis (B.A., Economics and Communications) and Vermont Law School (J.D.).

London

James Anderson is a Managing Director and Head of Capital Formation, EMEA at Canyon Partners based in London, UK. Prior to joining Canyon in 2023, Mr. Anderson was Head of the EMEA sales and capital raising business at Barings (fka Babson Capital) responsible for sales, marketing and client relationships in the region across public and private credit strategies, real estate and specialist equities. He was part of the European Management Team and also sat on the European Corporate Board that had responsibility and oversight for the strategic direction of the overall business. Before joining Babson Capital in 2011, Mr. Anderson worked at AllianceBernstein managing institutional and sub-advisory mandates across the UK and EMEA. He started his career working in private client wealth management in Hong Kong in 2006. Mr. Anderson is a graduate of Imperial College London (BSc. Hons).

Dallas

Allen Azran is Senior Vice President and Director of Security at Canyon. Mr. Azran joined Canyon in 2017 and is responsible for corporate safety and security, investigations, access control and all physical security systems and security program management across the firm. Mr. Azran is a current member of the International Association of Chief’s of Police and the FBI’s InfraGard; which is an organization serving as a public-private partnership between U.S. Businesses and the FBI. Mr. Azran is also a member of the U.S. State Department’s Overseas Security Advisory Council. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Azran spent 30 years with the Culver City Police Department where he served as a Police Officer, Field Training Officer, Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain and Assistant Chief of Police. Mr. Azran is a graduate of the University of Redlands (B.S., Business and Management).

Los Angeles

Jonathan Barzideh is an Investment Partner at Canyon. Mr. Barzideh joined Canyon in 2007 and serves as the lead Portfolio Manager for Canyon’s ESG investment activities as well as a Co-Portfolio Manager for the Canyon Dislocation Opportunities Fund IV. Additionally, Mr. Barzideh oversees a team that primarily focuses on investments in the energy, utilities, renewables, and chemical sectors as well as risk arbitrage investment opportunities. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Barzideh worked at Deutsche Bank, where he focused on event-driven, risk arbitrage, derivatives, and volatility strategies. Mr. Barzideh is a graduate of the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania (B.S., Economics, Concentrations in Finance and Statistics, Minor in Mathematics, Honors). Mr. Barzideh is a CFA® charterholder.

Los Angeles

William Boukalik is a Managing Director and Head of Asset Management within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Boukalik joined Canyon in 2011 and oversees the asset management and business plan execution of a portfolio of investments across property types as well as across both debt and equity. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Boukalik worked at The Connor Group, an owner and manager of multi-family properties, where he was responsible for debt execution, acquisition, and disposition activities of the firm. Previously, Mr. Boukalik was at DDR Corp where he was responsible for asset management and development/ redevelopment of retail investments throughout the U.S. Mr. Boukalik began his career at Ohio Savings Bank and Charter One Bank. Mr. Boukalik is a graduate of University of Richmond (B.A., Biology) and the Weatherhead School of Management at Case Western Reserve University (M.B.A.).

Los Angeles

Martin Downen is the Co-Head and Portfolio Manager for Canyon’s CLO business. Prior to joining Canyon in 2014, Mr. Downen was a Managing Director at Highland Capital where he oversaw a portfolio of par and distressed high yield debt and equity investments across the chemicals, consumer products, gaming, media, retail, power, utility, and print & publishing industries. Mr. Downen was also a Vice President in the Investment Banking Division at Goldman, Sachs & Co. in New York and an Associate at J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. in New York. Mr. Downen graduated from Brigham Young University (B.A. Economics) and the University of Michigan (M.B.A., concentrations in Finance and Corporate Strategy).

Dallas

Daniela Eden is a Senior Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Ms. Eden joined Canyon in 2012 and primary focuses on the asset management and business plan execution of a portfolio of investments across property types throughout the U.S. Prior to joining Canyon, Ms. Eden worked at BlackRock, where she was responsible for the asset management of multifamily, retail and office properties in various stages of development and investment cycles. Previously, Ms. Eden was at ASB Capital Management, where she focused on the underwriting and asset management of all property types across the country. Ms. Eden is a graduate of the University of California, Berkeley (B.A., Psychology) and Georgetown University (M.B.A.).

Dallas

Sarah Fidler is a Managing Director and Head Debt Trader at Canyon. Ms. Fidler joined Canyon in 2013 and oversees trading activity in credit market investments across the firm. Prior to this role, Ms. Fidler was the trader for Canyon’s European investments for over seven years before relocating to the United States. Prior to joining Canyon, Ms. Fidler worked at Goldman Sachs in Distressed Trading in both their London and New York offices. Ms. Fidler began her career at UBS as an investment banker in the Restructuring Group before moving to Cambridge Capital Partners in the private equity group. Ms. Fidler is a graduate of the University of Michigan (B.A., Business Administration) and the University of Chicago (M.B.A).

Dallas

Josh Friedman is Co-Founder, Co-Chairman and Co-Chief Executive Officer of Canyon Partners, LLC. Mr. Friedman is a graduate of Harvard College (B.A., summa cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa, Physics), Oxford University (M.A., honors, Politics and Economics, Marshall Scholar), Harvard Business School (M.B.A., Baker Scholar) and Harvard Law School (J.D., Sears Prize, magna cum laude). Prior to forming Canyon, Mr. Friedman was Director of Capital Markets for High Yield and Private Placements at Drexel Burnham Lambert. Prior to working at Drexel, Mr. Friedman worked in the Mergers and Acquisitions Department of Goldman Sachs in New York.

In 2014, Mr. Friedman, along with Co-Founder Mitch Julis, received Institutional Investor’s “Lifetime Achievement” Award. Mr. Friedman is a member of the George W. Bush Presidential Center Executive Advisory Council. Additionally, Mr. Friedman serves on the boards and/or investment committees of a number of endowments and foundations including Harvard Management Company, Harvard Committee on University Resources, California Institute of Technology, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, The Broad Foundation, Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA), and the Dallas Museum of Art (DMA). Mr. Friedman previously served on the investment committee of the J. Paul Getty Trust and Board of the Dean’s Advisors for Harvard Business School, as well as the boards of the Los Angeles Philharmonic, the UCLA Hospital Department of Neurosurgery, the UCLA Anderson School of Management, The California Science Center, and The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

Mr. Friedman and his wife, Beth, live in Dallas, Texas and have three sons. Mr. and Mrs. Friedman co-endowed the Star-Friedman Challenge for Promising Scientific Research at Harvard University and are 2019 recipients of the Ellis Island Medal of Honor.

Los Angeles

Gerald Goldman is a Managing Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Goldman joined Canyon in 2008 and primarily focuses on acquisitions, asset management, and business plan execution of equity investments in the Canyon Catalyst Fund, a CalPERS separate account focused on the real estate emerging manager space. Additionally, he coordinates the insurance risk management functions of CPRE. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Goldman worked at American Realty Advisors overseeing the asset and portfolio management of a diverse portfolio of core and value-added multi-family, office, industrial, and retail assets located nationally. Previously, he worked for The Archon Group, the real estate subsidiary of Goldman Sachs overseeing the operations, leasing and dispositions of a portfolio of office, retail and industrial assets. He began his career working for real estate developers and syndicators of multi-family assets. Mr. Goldman is a graduate of San Diego State University (B.S., Finance, cum laude). Mr. Goldman holds a California real estate brokers’ license and has earned the RPA designation from the BOMI Institute.

Los Angeles

Tammy Ho is a Senior Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Ms. Ho joined Canyon in 2011 and primarily focuses on investor reporting efforts across Canyon’s real estate platforms. Prior to this role, Ms. Ho was responsible for the asset management of a portfolio of debt and equity investments, with a concentration on hospitality assets. Prior to joining Canyon, Ms. Ho worked at Hilton Worldwide within the Feasibility and Investment Analysis department, where she was responsible for underwriting and managing existing and new hotel development projects. Previously, Ms. Ho worked at JPMorgan Chase & Co in the Real Estate and Lodging Investment Banking group. Ms. Ho is a graduate of Cornell University (B.S., Hotel Management with a Finance Concentration).

Dallas

Grant Johnson is a Senior Associate within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Johnson joined Canyon in 2022 and primary focuses on the asset management and business plan execution of a portfolio of investments across property types throughout the U.S and for originating, underwriting, structuring, and executing debt and equity investments in the Southwest U.S. region. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Johnson worked for the Strategy, Investments and M&A team at Cushman and Wakefield where he was responsible for analyzing and underwriting potential M&A transactions and strategic investments for the firm. Mr. Johnson has also previously held positions at J.P. Morgan within the Investment Bank. Mr. Johnson is a graduate of The University of Dayton (B.S., Finance).

Dallas

Mitch Julis is Co-Founder, Co-Chairman and Co-Chief Executive Officer of Canyon Partners, LLC. Mr. Julis is a graduate of the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs (B.A., magna cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa), Harvard Law School (J.D., magna cum laude) and Harvard Business School (M.B.A., honors). He received an honorary doctorate from Yeshiva University of New York in 2011. Prior to forming Canyon, Mr. Julis directed a group of professionals responsible for a portfolio of distressed and special situation securities at Drexel Burnham Lambert. Prior to working at Drexel, he was a bankruptcy and creditors’ rights attorney at Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz in New York. Mr. Julis has authored a number of articles published in law journals and other periodicals on the subject of bankruptcy, distressed credits and special situation investing.

In 2014, Mr. Julis, along with Co-Founder Josh Friedman, received Institutional Investor’s “Lifetime Achievement” Award. Mr. Julis serves as a Trustee of the Brown University Corporation, on the Board of Governors at the Watson Institute for International and Public Affairs at Brown University, on the Board of Trustees at Yeshiva University and as Trustee Emeritus at the Asia Society. He previously served on the Board of Trustees at Princeton University. He is currently a member of the Advisory Council for the Julis-Rabinowitz Center for Public Policy and Finance at the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs and a member of Princeton’s School of Engineering and Applied Science Leadership Council. Furthermore, he sits on the Lincoln Center Theater Board of Directors. Also noteworthy is his active role in establishing the Harvard Law School Program on Jewish and Israeli Law. In 2019, Mr. Julis received an Honorary Fellowship from the Technion – Israel Institute of Technology.

Mr. Julis and his wife, Joleen, reside in Dallas, TX and have 4 children.

Dallas

Todd Lemkin is an Investment Partner and Chief Investment Officer of Canyon Capital Advisors. Mr. Lemkin joined Canyon in 2003 and is responsible for the efforts of CCA’s portfolio team to develop, analyze, and implement investment ideas across the firm’s global platform. Mr. Lemkin has extensive investment expertise across the cable, media, telecom, satellite, industrials, real estate, gaming, and packaging sectors. Prior to this role, Mr. Lemkin focused on Canyon’s European investment effort and the firm’s London office. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Lemkin worked at Scoggin Capital Management, where he focused on analyzing securities of distressed and bankrupt companies. Mr. Lemkin was also an Investment Banker in the Healthcare Group of Banc of America Securities and the Mergers & Acquisitions Group of Lehman Brothers. Mr. Lemkin is a member of the Board of Governors of Cedar Sinai Hospital as well as a Director of Atlas Crest Investment Corp. (“ACII”). Mr. Lemkin is a graduate of the University of California, Berkeley (B.A., English).

Los Angeles

Frank Liu is a Managing Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Liu joined Canyon in 2011 and oversees a team that primarily focuses on originating, underwriting, structuring, and executing debt and equity investments in the Northwest and Midwest U.S. regions. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Liu worked for the real estate investment arm of a family office based in Los Angeles, where he was responsible for the group’s capital markets activities. Mr. Liu has also previously held positions at Lowe Enterprises and JBG SMITH (formerly The JBG Companies). Mr. Liu is a graduate of Georgetown University (B.A., Economics and Government) and The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University (M.B.A.).

Dallas

Will Mirshak is a Managing Director on the Strategy team at Canyon. Prior to joining Canyon in 2022, Mr. Mirshak worked at UTIMCO where he was a Senior Director on the Private Equity team and led the Private Credit and Private Equity Co-Investment portfolios. Prior to joining UTIMCO, Mr. Mirshak worked at Mesirow where he led a hedge fund portfolio of multi-strategy and event-driven hedge funds. Mr. Mirshak began his career in investment banking, primarily focused on financial restructuring and industry coverage of the technology, media and telecom and gaming and lodging sectors. Mr. Mirshak is a graduate of the University of Richmond (B.S., Economics) and received a Masters in Business Administration from the University of Chicago.

Los Angeles

Joe Pfeiffer is a Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Pfeiffer joined Canyon in 2017 and primarily focuses on acquisitions, asset management, and business plan execution of equity investments in the Canyon Catalyst Fund, a CalPERS separate account focused on the real estate emerging manager space. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Pfeiffer worked at the New York City Economic Development Corporation, where he was responsible for repositioning and managing underperforming real estate investments owned by the City of New York. Additionally, Mr. Pfeiffer has held positions at L+M Development Partners and PCCP, LLC. Mr. Pfeiffer is a graduate of Lehigh University (B.S., Finance with a minor in French Modern Languages and Literature) and the UCLA Anderson School of Management (M.B.A., Real Estate).

Los Angeles

Robin Potts is a Partner and Chief Investment Officer for CPRE. Ms. Potts has been with Canyon Partners since 2006, and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of Canyon Partners’ real estate platforms and holds a seat on all Canyon Partners real estate investment committees. During her tenure at Canyon Partners, Ms. Potts has facilitated the acquisition, financing and development of ~$22 billion of commercial real estate transactions across all asset classes including multifamily, condominium, office, retail, hospitality, industrial, senior housing, student housing, self-storage and mixed-use. Ms. Potts previously worked in the Financial Institutions Group of Credit Suisse in Los Angeles where she focused on equity, debt and M&A transactions in the mortgage real estate investment trust sector. Ms. Potts is a graduate of Harvard University, where she earned a B.A. degree in Economics.

New York

Kevin Scholz is a Director within the Real Estate Investment team at Canyon. Mr. Scholz joined Canyon in 2009 and primarily focuses on the asset management and business plan execution of equity and debt investments across Canyon’s real estate platforms. Prior to joining Canyon, Mr. Scholz worked at Ernst & Young LLP as a Senior Auditor in the Asset Management division of the Financial Services Office. Prior to Ernst & Young, Mr. Scholz was a Research Specialist Intern for the Securities and Exchange Commission. Mr. Scholz is a graduate of Iona College (B.B.A., Accounting, summa cum laude) and the University of Miami (M.B.A., Finance and International Business). Mr. Scholz is a CFA® charterholder and a Certified Public Accountant (inactive).

Hong Kong

Roslyn Zhang is a Managing Director within the Client Relations and Business Development team at Canyon. Ms. Zhang joined Canyon in 2020 and primarily focuses on maintaining and developing investor relationships in the APAC region, with a primary focus on China. Prior to joining Canyon, Ms. Zhang worked at China Investment Corporation where she was Managing Director and the Head of Hedge Fund Investments for the firm. Previously, Ms. Zhang held positions at a New York-based Fund of Hedge Funds and two endowment funds in both U.S and Canada. Ms. Zhang began her career at Manulife Financial in the firm’s Investment Division. Ms. Zhang is a graduate of McGill University (M.B.A.), and from the Central University of Finance and Economy in China (B.A., Economics). In 2013, Ms. Zhang was named “50 Leading Women in Hedge Funds” by Hedge Fund Journal.
